meanings.sent1: The new puzzle was fiddlier than I expected.
meanings.sent2: The delicate model was fiddlier to assemble than I thought.
meanings.sent3: Trying to untangle the knots in the yarn became a fiddlier task than I imagined.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like a fiddlier web, intricate and hard to navigate.
meanings.sent5: The fiddlier the problem, the more satisfying the solution.

meanings.definition: Requiring more skill or effort to manipulate
meanings.sent1: The advanced level of the game was fiddlier for the beginners.
meanings.sent2: The intricate design of the clock made it fiddlier to repair.
meanings.sent3: His attempts to juggle the balls became fiddlier as he added more.
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves were as fiddlier as a master pianist's fingers on the keys.
meanings.sent5: The fiddlier the technique, the more impressive the result.

meanings.definition: Tending to cause frustration or annoyance
meanings.sent1: The fiddlier instructions on the manual confused the users.
meanings.sent2: The tiny buttons on the remote control were fiddlier to press.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics became fiddlier when it knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The fiddlier situation reminded him of a tangled ball of yarn.
meanings.sent5: Dealing with fiddlier tasks can lead to valuable problem-solving skills.
